title: Great App!!
comment: It is indeed is a great app. Unfortunately, my phone got warm while I'm using it... Please fix it. Since that shouldn't be happened for normal app... Thx.
Likely because Remote Keyboard holds a wakelock while a client is connected. Nothing can be done there. You probably don't want the screen to time out while you are typing.

title: Great App!
comment: Just add more layman instruction for starters. But as it is, excellent!

This is SUCH a useful app! I use it every day at work as well as at home.  I've even included it in my startup batch script haha.  Using the keyboard via USB is a little trickier than via WiFi as you have to enable debugging on your device and also have to use ADB to forward a port to 2323 from the computer, but this process is very easy to script as ADB is a command line tool.  5 stars because I haven't had a single problem with it yet!

Can anyone help me use this? I do not understand. I have it setup via usb and adb and have been entering the command to connect in a terminal, but NOTHING happens after that. What command do I enter after   adb forward tcp:2323 tcp:2323 . I'm on ubuntu.
telnet localhost 2323
Nice keyboard

This app is useless. After installing putty and making the connection, nothing happens when you type in the putty window. No window is presented to the user as depicted in the "tutorial" and with this app running, I can't send or receive text messages. Complete waste.

title: Simple, extremely effective.
comment: I love this app. It's simple, fast and really effective. I haven't found any bugs so far and the experience is really smooth as long as you know how to use telnet, which isn't hard.

title: Beautifully simple and works!
comment: This app is great when I'm at work to allow me to type on my phone using my computer's keyboard. Requires ADB on the computer, but I simply run the following commands to connect to my phone: "adb forward tcp:2323 tcp:2323" and "telnet localhost 2323"
i was amazed to find this free and not requiring root access. love it, 10/10

title: Dont understand
comment: Tried connecting to client sais no client connected

title: useful, simple, techy
comment: works beautifully, simple and without a hickup. It's not for the very casual user due to the telnet client. but as a bit of a power user this is great! however how do I close the app / get rid of the notification once I disconnected my computer from my phone?
Either by using the disconnect button or by switchign to another input method.

title: Works VERY easy
comment: Great app thank you

title: Nice.
comment: Works great for the most part. I love the no-lag connection when using my PC keyboard to type in WhatsApp and the stock SMS app. The one drawback is navigation functionality, which could use some work... For example, I can use CTRL+Q to back out of a WhatsApp conversation, and then I can use up/down arrows to move around my current conversations, but there is no way to actually enter into a different conversation!  With my stock SMS app, on the other hand, I can select a conversation from my list of current conversations and enter into any one with my keyboard ENTER key; i can then back out of that conversation using CTRL+Q, but at that point I'm completely frozen! Up/down doesn't work anymore, CTRL+Q doesn't work anymore...so I'm forced to pick up the phone again. Still the best remote keyboard app I've ever seen, though (: (I think step-by-step installation instructions would be helpful to those who have no experience using a telnet connection, by the way.)
That's a problem with WhatsApp not handling keyboard input properly.

title: Great App
comment: Love the app. Finally able to quickly and easily enter information from my keyboard.

title: Very helpful app and works with Cyrillic!!
comment: Had a little difficulty connecting. Finally figured out that my laptop and phone were using different wi-fi. After I connected them to the same wi-fi it worked great! I am using Cyrillic and the app has no problem with that too! THANKS A LOT!

comment: i really hate it

title: Good app, Thanks for sharing
comment: Here is a humble advice to make it better: if there will be a feature enable the user to type foreign language from the PC that will be Awesome.  Over nice ideas, nice work!

title: Garbage app is garbage.
comment: Read and re-read the "instructions" (if that's what you want to call them).  Apparently I need to have WiFi enabled for this to work, and nowhere in the "instructions" does it say this.  Only reading the reviews revealed that little important bit of information. Shouldn't a USB connection be sufficient? And this app needs to run through WiFi? Really? Nice and secure. Oh, and I'll preempt your snobby reply to your critics by saying "You're welcome for the 1-star rating. It really was my pleasure."

The Google Play description clearly says "via wlan" and that you need a telnet CLIENT. It also mentions the option of forwarding the network connection via USB for security reasons and the FAQ tells you how to. So, yes, thanks for the 1* rating. Reading skills would have prevented this snobby reply.

comment: Works as claimed flawlessly. Kudos to the developers for giving this out for free without ads.

title: Awesome app, but it does not support Chinese
comment: I'm willing to pay for it if Chinese is supported.

I don't speak chinese, so there is no way in which I could support that language. Chances are that your problem is client side, though. Check your telnet client for an option called "character encoding". It must be set to UTF-8 or similar.

title: Works perfectly but needs some important upgrades.
comment: The app works flawlessly with the PC keyboard. But there should be some necessary upgrades like the option to select, cut, copy, paste using the PC keyboard. And another important thing how to use emojis when on the PC keyboard, its necessary for texting apps.

title: Really handy ! A more secure option would be nice.
comment: Great for when your in a pinch, and, for whatever reason you need to enter some long strings of text into your phone. (eg. command line interface, or an app that doesn't support copy+paste). It would be nice if a more secure option than telnet was utilised, but, when used on a private network this isn't a problem. (5th star for not needing to connect to some online server!)
You could tunnel your network traffic through an USB cable (see FAQ).

title: Can't connect via telnet.
comment: Tried it with multiple computers, I can ping my phone, I can see that port 2323 is open and listening, but it keeps giving me a connection refused.  Really wish it worked, it looks like exactly what I'm looking for.   Samsung Galaxy S4 mini.  Which has multiple software problems as I understand.  4 stars, because skewing the results for *my* phone's problem is a dick move.
It may be a hanging session. Reselecting the keyboard might help.

title: Amazing
comment: This app does exactly what it says...!!

What a neat app. I am using it to write this review. I installed puttytel.exe, which I found by a Google search, on my desktop. First I click on the app remote keyboard, choose remote keyboard as the keyboard, then I click on the puttytel.exe on the desktop with the settings described in the app, and it does work. You can save the settings as default settings so you don't have to enter them each time. So a few clicks and I have the remote keyboard working. Thanks for this app.

title: good and light but...
comment: This app is good and light, you don't have to install extra application on the PC, just using the telnet software from there, but, it would be great if the app able to cooperate with the existing selected keyboard input rather than we had to switch to this app input method everytime we want to type from a PC, and lastly, the latencies, I guess it can't be helped since this app only acted as some kind of a telnet server or something.  The app kept appearing on the notification quite annoying as well

title: Security?
comment: App runs good, but what is with the penetration. Telnet is without encryption. Is there any way to bring a backup so I can create a ssh connection?  If you made this for me and other Unix user you will get the last star and your missing video from me! ;-)

There is no suitable java ssh server library and that's not a thing you implement on your own. If you cannot trust your WLAN, you should forward telnet through an USBcable (which has the nice side effect of also charging your device). See docs for details.

title: Amazing App, but one problem
comment: its a brilliant app for what it does, but there is one problem with the app that it cannot backspace or delete the character once its written. Hope I can get the solution for it. Thanks a lot. :)

The solution is to switch local echo off in the telnet client and look exclusively at the Android screen ;). Trying to have the output on two screens turned out to be completely unergonomic and thats one of the reasons it's not supported.

title: Problem in connecting.. .. note3

Bonus points (and extra 1337 factor) for the use of telnet, which means you can use any PC with any OS over bluetooth, wi-fi, tethering, etc. if you know anything about computer networking.

I think it will be a good thing (for me). But I very very like this application. So love it, thank you so much for creating this :D

title: Simple and does what it says
comment: Allows you to use any computer and connect it via telnet to your phone. Some instructions on how to use telnet in the apps help would be appreciated though. But I figured it out. (Open telnet client. In telnet type "o [ip address of phone] [port number (2323)]". Press enter. If you set a pswd type that and your in. Then type on ur computer keyboard and it shows in your phone. )

Super app

title: Finally :)
comment: ok, gotta give this app 500000 out of 10. First app that I have used on Android that actually lived up to its description AND then some. I purchased a bluetooth keyboard for my tablet, and it's pathetic. doubles the keys, some dont even register, laggy.. but this app? one small telnet session? and it works! I was dubious. but it's great, and if only shift+arrow keys allowed you to copy individual letters out of text, it would be perfect. I am amazed this works so well, terminals are now a pleasure to use :) Cheers!

title: Well done! Thanks!
comment: The only trick is figuring out how to connect telnet:  1) Install telnet in Windows (do a google search to see how) 2) BEFORE connecting, select Remote Keyboard as INPUT METHOD.   3) the letter "o" followed by a space, the IP address, another space, and the port you see on your Android Remote Keyboard app. 4) Voila!  I was typing so fast my cheap Android got laggy! :)
Exactly what I as looking for.

title: Excellent
comment: Works as described. Low delay, stable connection. Makes it easy to switch back to the default keyboard. No ads.

title: Just what I wanted
comment: Very easy to set up and use.  The only drawback recently is that the program seems to be running even when no other app is using thus keyboard.
That's intented. You can use Remote Keyboard on your homescreen as well, e.g. for navigating icons or using your F-Keys as quicklaunchers for starting apps (see: settings).
Wonderful app! Just a little bit confusing when setting it up the first time.
Useful tool when you are tired to use the phone keypad.

You may need to tell your telnet client to send characters UTF-8 encoded. If that's not the solution, please contact me via Email with a detailed description of the problem.

Here's another tip for people using Gingerbread, you can press and hold on any text input and change your input method from the menu that appears.
It does! The problem is that your telnet client is not configured to send characters UTF-8 encoded. With Putty, the option is under Window|Translation
